name: Headon Warren Walk, Isle of Wight

ai.summary: A 14.7 km coastal hike on the Isle of Wight following Headon Warren’s chalk downs with coastal views, grassy paths and rural lanes. A moderate route with varied surfaces and some exposed sections, suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly chalk down paths and grassy tracks with some compacted dirt, short road sections and exposed cliff-top edges. Expect uneven bits, loose gravel and a firm surface in parts; careful footing near edges.
ai.safety_notes: Be mindful of cliff edges and erosion along coastal sections; winds can be strong and unpredictable, even on sunny days; stay back from the edge, especially in wet or windy conditions. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip, bring a map or GPS, and ensure you have a charged phone, water and nutrition. Tell someone your planned route and return time. In winter and poor weather, daylight is limited and paths can be muddy; sun protection is advisable in summer.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing including a waterproof jacket
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring (March–May) and autumn (September–October) are ideal for comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds; summer brings long days but more wind and crowds; winter walks are possible but more challenging due to shorter daylight and weather.

seo.title: Headon Warren Walk, Isle of Wight – 14.7 km Coastal Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore Headon Warren Walk on the Isle of Wight. A 14.7 km moderate coastal hike with chalk downs, cliff-top views and varied terrain. Safety tips and gear included.
seo.h1: Headon Warren Walk (Isle of Wight) – 14.7 km Coastal Hike
